overview:
## Discussion

The value of this property is a constant indicating the type of the slider. Possible values are described in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSlider/SliderType-swift.enum].

When the value of this property is `NSCircularSlider`, then you get a fixed-size circular slider. The minimum value ([doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSliderCell/minValue]) is at the top, and the value increases clockwise around the dial. The maximum selectable value is just below [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSliderCell/maxValue]; for example, if [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSliderCell/maxValue] is 360, you can set the dial up to 359.999.

You can use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSliderCell/numberOfTickMarks] property to display tick marks, and you can use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSliderCell/allowsTickMarkValuesOnly] property to specify that values are limited to those values represented by tick marks. You can set this control to regular or small sizes; the mini size is not supported.

# sliderType

**Instance Property**

The slider type, either linear or circular.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var sliderType: NSSlider.SliderType { get set }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is a constant indicating the type of the slider. Possible values are described in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSlider/SliderType-swift.enum].

When the value of this property is `NSCircularSlider`, then you get a fixed-size circular slider. The minimum value ([doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSliderCell/minValue]) is at the top, and the value increases clockwise around the dial. The maximum selectable value is just below [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSliderCell/maxValue]; for example, if [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSliderCell/maxValue] is 360, you can set the dial up to 359.999.

You can use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSliderCell/numberOfTickMarks] property to display tick marks, and you can use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSliderCell/allowsTickMarkValuesOnly] property to specify that values are limited to those values represented by tick marks. You can set this control to regular or small sizes; the mini size is not supported.
